task.title: Customize the look of the HTML pages generated by ditac
task.abstract: We'll explain how to customize the look of the HTML pages generated by ditac by using an example. Let's suppose we want to render topic titles in a nice dark blue color rather than in black.The customization method described below will not work for formats for which the generated HTML pages are automatically compiled or archived. This is the case for HTML HelpHTML Help, output format, Java HelpJava Help, output format and EPUBEPUB 2, output format.

taskbody.context: The easiest way to customize the look of the HTML pages generated by ditac is to use a custom CSSCSS, custom stylesheet rather than the stock one.

step.stepxmp: Initial contents of the custom CSS stylesheet (a copy of this file is found in ).@import url(basic.css);

step.cmd: Add one or more rules to the custom CSS stylesheet.
step.info:
The XSLT stylesheets generating XHTML/HTML pages make extensive use of the class attribute. Generally the XHTML element generated for a DITA element has a class attribute bearing the name of the DITA element. Example: a DITA

is converted to a XHTML

step.cmd: Specify the "-p css res/custom.css" optioncss, parameter when running ditac.

stepxmp.screen: $ ditac -images img -p xsl-resources-directory res \ -p css res/custom.css \ out/manual/_.html manual.ditamap

step.cmd: Last but not least, do not forget to copy custom.css to the resources subdirectory of the output directory (out/manual/res/ in the case of the above example). The ditac command-line cannot do that automatically for you.
